formattedAddress: 4 E 36th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 4 E 36th St, New York, NY 10016, USA

editorialSummary.text: Destination for inspired Middle East-Mediterranean fusion plates in an ornate, exotic setting.

originalText.text: Beautiful restaurant! The food was amazing as well as the drinks. The lamb sausage was our favorite! The best part of it all was that the service was impeccable. Both the server and the restaurant manager really made an impression on us.

text.text: Beautiful restaurant! The food was amazing as well as the drinks. The lamb sausage was our favorite! The best part of it all was that the service was impeccable. Both the server and the restaurant manager really made an impression on us.

originalText.text: I can't speak on authenticity of the food but it's flavor is a bit disappointing. More attention is given to presentation and atmosphere than the actual flavors. The decor and overall atmosphere is beautiful and relaxing. The staff was attentive and courteous. The vegetable portion for the steak entree is ridiculously small. I literally got only 3 small pieces of mushrooms, 3 small slices of carrots, about 4 to 5 string beans and 2 small broccoli. The steak was a decent size and was "well done" just as I ordered. The fries were are delicious though they also came in a small portion size bowl. Overall it's was an"okay" experience. Nothing special.

text.text: I can't speak on authenticity of the food but it's flavor is a bit disappointing. More attention is given to presentation and atmosphere than the actual flavors. The decor and overall atmosphere is beautiful and relaxing. The staff was attentive and courteous. The vegetable portion for the steak entree is ridiculously small. I literally got only 3 small pieces of mushrooms, 3 small slices of carrots, about 4 to 5 string beans and 2 small broccoli. The steak was a decent size and was "well done" just as I ordered. The fries were are delicious though they also came in a small portion size bowl. Overall it's was an"okay" experience. Nothing special.

originalText.text: The food here is very good although I’m told that it’s not particularly authentic. Service is friendly, but unrefined. They offer hookah and the back room is reserved for belly dancing shows after 9 pm. The restaurant does a nice job giving it’s guests a Moroccan style dining experience, so if that’s what you’re looking for, it’s worth a try.

text.text: The food here is very good although I’m told that it’s not particularly authentic. Service is friendly, but unrefined. They offer hookah and the back room is reserved for belly dancing shows after 9 pm. The restaurant does a nice job giving it’s guests a Moroccan style dining experience, so if that’s what you’re looking for, it’s worth a try.

originalText.text: We didn’t have a terrible experience here tonight, just an above average one. On the plus side, the ambiance was pleasant, we arrived early at 8pm on Saturday and the place was quiet. It did start to fill up by 9pm. Cocktails were great and the food was a bit better than average (for those looking for an authentic Moroccan meal, this might not be the place). Staff were accommodating. Good place for a 1st date. Appetizers were average. Nothing mind blowing, but not unpleasant. Mains are good for 2 but again, you won’t be disappointed however certainly don’t expect to be blown away.

text.text: We didn’t have a terrible experience here tonight, just an above average one. On the plus side, the ambiance was pleasant, we arrived early at 8pm on Saturday and the place was quiet. It did start to fill up by 9pm. Cocktails were great and the food was a bit better than average (for those looking for an authentic Moroccan meal, this might not be the place). Staff were accommodating. Good place for a 1st date. Appetizers were average. Nothing mind blowing, but not unpleasant. Mains are good for 2 but again, you won’t be disappointed however certainly don’t expect to be blown away.

originalText.text: It has a hookah bar in the back which is apparently very expensive. I caught an occasional whiff of it and could hear all the dancing from where I was sitting. The decorations are cute and the ambience is nice. The mint tea was $10 per person, which I consider pretty pricey for the experience. The waiters were very attentive with us and making sure we got what we needed. The food itself was very good and sweet, but the salad was kind of weird since the cheese came in huge chunks and it was not tossed.
